An extended executive four bedroom detached home in the ever popular residential district of Hampton Dene. Recently, this property has been completely refurbished to offer a stylish, contemporary home with ample off-road parking and spacious garage with electric roller door.
Throughout the home, quality has not been compromised. With Engineered Lacquered rustic Oak flooring to the ground floor, Silver Chalice - Inviticus range carpet fitted to all bedrooms on the first floor, two en-suite shower rooms and a large family bathroom featuring electric under-floor heating . A beautiful entrance hall with staircase, carpeted and with open wood and glass panel design sets the tone for the remainder of the property.
In all, the property comprises: Entrance Hall - Downstairs Cloakroom - Living Room - Large Kitchen/Living/Dining Room - Utility Room - Garage - Four Double Bedrooms - two En-Suite Shower Rooms - Family Bathroom.

room.description: A spacious, family-focused Kitchen, Living and Dining area. Fully-fitted in white high-gloss units smartly contrasted by luxurious Casablanca White Granite countertops, the Kitchen offers an array of clever storage including pan and deep drawers and corner carousel rack. Integrated are three ovens of which offer steaming, microwave, grilling and traditional oven capabilities featuring a plate warmer below. Sink benefits from having a 'instant' hot cooker tap facility, a macerator and the added benefit of offering fully filtered water to the kitchen. A generous granite Island complete with a Wine Cooler, storage drawers, rising Power and USB console and a state of the art 4 ring induction hob with additional gas ring wok/hob. This unit is completed with a Bluetooth over-head extractor, activating when the Hob is in use. Bronzed, three piece light fitting hangs over the island for a stylish finish. Built-in dishwasher, Samsung Fridge/Freezer with Ice machine offering both Crushed and Cubed Ice. Beautifully designed Bi-fold doors to the rear allow for a true 'inside/outside' feeling within this executive and highly styled kitchen.

Within the gardens there are a range of mature trees and shrubs and in the paddock there are various fruit trees and timber shed.

room.name: Additional Information
room.description:
This property is offered with a price starting at £45,000 for 25% share with Shropshire Housing. Buildings Insurance £3.12 per month Service Charge £24.90 per month Sinking Fund £10.34 per month. Rent of 25% share = £309.38
Qualifying criteria applies to anyone looking to buy a shared ownership property. Help to buy - shared ownership is aimed at people who maybe can't afford to buy on the open market but wish to buy a home of their own. Although everyone's circumstances are different, you will need to fulfil the following criteria: *Must be OVER 18 *Not able to purchase on the open market *Income of less than £80,000 and more than £12,000 *Confirmed permanent employment *UK resident or right to remain *If you need to sell, you may qualify however, you would need to complete both sale and purchase at the same time.
You will need to register with Helptobuymidland.co.uk if you wish to progress an application. Purchasers will be expected to maximise the share they purchase depending on their circumstances. The rent example is based on a 25% share purchase

property.advert4: Bredenbury has a church, village hall, public house and primary school and approximately 3.5 miles is the local and historic market town of Bromyard which offers an extensive range of amenities including a theatre, library, doctor’s surgery, shops, leisure centre and supermarket. The Bromyard Downs and Bringsty common provide plenty of walking opportunities and the national trust estate of Brockhampton is also located nearby. The cathedral cities of Hereford and Worcester are easily accessible and both offer a further extensive range of recreational, educational, retail and leisure facilities.
property.advert5: From Bromyard proceed on the A44 towards Leominster for approximately 2.7 miles and upon reaching the sign for Bredenbury village take the second left hand turn as indicated by the Agents pointer board and sign for Brockington Grange. Continue along noting the garaging on the left hand side and the communal parking is found just after.

room.name: Additional Information
room.description:
This property is offered with a price starting at £45,000 for 25% share with Shropshire Housing. Buildings Insurance £3.12 per month Service Charge £24.90 per month Sinking Fund £10.34 per month. Rent on 25% share = £309.38 Qualifying criteria applies to anyone looking to buy a shared ownership property. Help to buy - shared ownership is aimed at people who maybe can't afford to buy on the open market but wish to buy a home of their own. Although everyone's circumstances are different, you will need to fulfil the following criteria: *Must be OVER 18 *Not able to purchase on the open market *Income of less than £80,000 and more than £12,000 *Confirmed permanent employment *UK resident or right to remain *If you need to sell, you may qualify however, you would need to complete both sale and purchase at the same time.
You will need to register with www.helptobuymidland.co.uk if you wish to progress an application. Purchasers will be expected to maximise the share they purchase depending on their circumstances. The rent example is based on a 25% share purchase

A three/four bedroom detached house ( Over 2 floors) in the popular village of Lugwardine with central heating and double glazing. This charming and deeply characterful property offers an interesting home with a good sized garden. The main of the house dating back to the 1640's is a true charm. Exposed beams, Godwin flooring and iron fittings help to recreate a sense of history with a lounge that offers a cosy heart of this home with its large Inglenook. Being extended over the years through the Victorian era to more modern times, this property has grown and now offers a spacious, practical home for a family and offers a few surprises along the way.We highly recommend a viewing of this property to fully appreciate all that it has to offer. EPC - D

room.name: Exterior
room.description:
This property has parking for several vehicles to the front. There is side access both via the front and by passing between the property and garage. The garage has an up and over door with power and lighting. From the Study room, via the door is a patio area with a large lockable wood built storage shed with further patio and path leading to a portion of land which is used as a vegetable plot.
The main area of the south facing garden is walled, offering a truly private, enclosed feel yet offering ample space to be enjoyed in several ways. Initially, passing through a doorway from the vegetable garden, you are greeted with a patio area with a range of borders of shrubs and plants. This extends to a Summer House and pergola with wisteria and seating areas. Along side the rear of the property, a pathway leads through the pergola with its climbers and plants to a wonderful garden. Various plants, shrubs and mature bushes compliment this garden. There is a grass area and further brick-laid terrace. Panel fencing encloses the garden to the side and there are raised beds with mature plants. There is an outside water tap for convenience, side access to the front and entrance in to the workshop/utility. A truly delightful garden offering privacy, versatility and splendid summer enjoyment with the convenience of access via several doorways.

property.main_advert: A charming, highly characterful period property set in the Golden Valley. This circa 1500's built property was once a farmhouse and has since been extended (circa 1800's) to provide a semi-detached country home set in approximately 1 acre of ground. The property enjoys views across the Golden Valley and is rich in period features. There is a small brook which runs past the property and walks to the countryside are just a step outside the front door. A well is situated to the front of the property and there is a large garden which is decorated with fruit trees and excellent views can be enjoyed. The property itself is a three bedroom, semi-detached cottage and features three reception rooms, a spacious kitchen/dining room, downstairs shower room and Crafts Room. A large inglenook with a wood burning stove in place is the centre-piece of the living area with limestone flooring to the entrance hall, crafts room, lounge, study and dining area. Double glazed and centrally heated with its coal fueled Aga, this property is full of charm and together with its setting, makes for a unique home.
